concept.title: Integrating an External Parameter Configuration Tool

section.p: A supplier organization can integrate a third-party or proprietary tool for configuring service parameters with and for viewing the prices of parameters per subscription and/or per user. The tool can be used by the supplier's customers for defining and updating the parameters of a service. It replaces the default user interface for configuring service parameters on a marketplace.

allows for a seamless integration of the tool. A generic JavaScript interface is provided by which supplier organizations can integrate a tool of their choice. The following basic concepts are relevant:

ul.li: Cross-document messaging is used for the communication between and an external parameter configuration tool.
The exchange of data is based on JavaScript Object Notation (JSON).

section.p: The sections of this chapter describe the basic concepts and give an overview of the required implementation tasks of a developer.
